content: I haven’t read every book on the list yet, but I agree with you on “To Kill A Mockingbird”, Shane Parrish. Atticus Finch is a character we should all look up to. He’s a paragon of a hero, defending African Americans despite others’ opinions and threats, and facing everything with cool calmness and remarkable courage. He’s especially independent, so which is why he seems rather detached. However, all in all, he’s still a perfect example of both an honorable parent and a righteous lawyer.
